meanings.sent1: The apple will outdrop from the tree soon.
meanings.sent2: I watched the last leaf outdrop from the branch.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outdrop the acorn into its stash.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to outdrop the class surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The rain will outdrop from the dark clouds any minute now.

meanings.definition: A drop that falls outside of something
meanings.sent1: The outdrop of water landed on the ground.
meanings.sent2: I noticed an outdrop of paint on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The outdrop of sauce on his shirt made him look silly.
meanings.sent4: The outdrop of sunlight through the window was beautiful.
meanings.sent5: She caught the outdrop of ice cream before it hit the table.
